page.title: 01THE HILLS WEST OF DENBIGH
page.content: The area is composed of rolling hills and valleys, the result of glacial action ranging in height up to approx 400m. Farms and cottages are scattered throughout the block and agriculture is very important, particularly sheep farming. Farms range in size from 20 acres upwards. Many people who live in this countryside commute to nearby towns to work, particularly professional people. There are a couple of small villages with general stores. Most inhabitants are Welsh speaking as their first language and proud of their identity. Incomers from England are treated in a friendly way. Climate is often damp with cold winters but the area is very beautiful, dear and alive.
